```{r load-in-data}
kangaroo_rats <- read_csv(here("data", "dat_for_prob1.csv")) %>% 
  # make the column names cleaner
  clean_names()
```

```{r}
gg_miss_var(kangaroo_rats)
```

```{r}
skim(kangaroo_rats)
```

```{r}
# Cleaning and wrangling
data <- kangaroo_rats %>%
  drop_na()    # Remove rows with missing values

# Assumption checks
# Checking normality assumption
shapiro.test(data$seeds)

# Checking homogeneity of variances assumption
leveneTest(seeds ~ loc, data = data)

# Statistical tests
# One-way ANOVA
anova_result <- aov(seeds ~ loc, data = data)
summary(anova_result)

# Post hoc test (Tukey's HSD)
tukey_result <- TukeyHSD(anova_result)
tukey_result

# Null hypotheses
# H0: There is no difference in seed counts between locations

# Other tools for count (discrete) data:
# Kruskal-Wallis test (non-parametric alternative to ANOVA)
kruskal.test(seeds ~ loc, data = data)
```
